availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Evans (Kentucky farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Kentucky farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Amos Evans and Polly Evans. Farm laborer in Grayson County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a 2nd Lieutenant Colonel from June 15, 1863 to February 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 488.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 432..
Find A Grave, "John W. Evans (Aug. 10, 1843-Nov. 2, 1919)," Memorial #108861478, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108861478 (accessed June 18, 2020).
